bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, January 26, 1929

div1.p: Carter reports on the progress made on the retyping and reorganization of bibliographical references to the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, January 26, 1929
div1.opener:
Book - Misel
Report - weekly.
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
January 26, 1929.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
I have just put in a very full week's work, beginning last
Sunday morning, on which day Miss Brown stayed here until about 9 P. HM.
We also put in an evening's work together last Thursday and are planning
to get a good deal done this week,-end, which she will spend with me. Miss
Brown is still considerably the worse for her recent illness, but, since
resuming active duty, she has already saved me much time and considerable
work, by checking things for me at the Library of Congress and at her apart-
ment at night.

The work on the retyping, and frequent recasting, of the remaining
bibliographic cards is going on well. I sent a lot of material to Dr.
Frost this week and hope that he will find the cards, made out according
to his plan of last December, half as satisfactory and time-saving as he
anticipated. It is careful, tedious work, which I have to do myself, since,
as I wrote you before, its too specialized for anyone not familiar with it,
and Miss Brown, unfortunately, does not know how to use a typewriter. How-
ever, if I can keep on at the present rate this should not matter much
longer.
With very best remembrances, I remain
div1.closer:
Most truly yours, (Signed) Laura A. Carter. Dr. Frederick F. Russell,
Director,
International Health Division
The Rockefeller Foundation,
61 Broadway, New York, N. Y.
